To
e Company of March
a
ts Adv
e
turers at Midd
b
ourgh N
o
3 1591.

page.lettertext:
fol.251r
1591 3 November To the Marchants Adven
t
of Middell
b
Belgia: 1591: No
v
Upon
e sight of yo
r
letter, w
ch
I receaved by this bearer
M
r
Wheeler
I have
urged yo
r
affaires to
e
General States
, to suche effect, as you reque
s
ted. But as their custome is alwaies, they will never yeelde to alter
any publicke resolution, w
t
out
e privitie and assent of
e States of
every Province, whome they use to calle their Principals. And this
is ever their maner in all the motions of her
Ma
tie
of w
at
soever
q
a
litie or importance. W
ch
was also the effect of their answear unto me.
So as when the time of their recesse is issued, w
ch
is the 20 of De
c
I will not faile to calle upon them a freshe, for some further satisfaction.
In
e meane season, you shall not neede for these occasions to troble any
of yo
r
company, but only my selfe, while I tarry in these Contreis,
assuring you that not only in this case, but in w
at
soever other matter
you please to use me, you shall finde me fully as foreward, as my
abilitie, or knowe ledge, or any meanes
at I can worke, may stande you
any way in steede.
Hage N
o
3 1591.
